titles.title: United States Military Academy Bicentennial Commemorative Coin Act of 1993
A bill to authorize the minting of coins to commemorate the 200th anniversary of the founding of the United States Military Academy at West Point, New York.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S15607)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking.

committee.name: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

bill.summary: 11/10/1993--Introduced. United States Military Academy Bicentennial Commemorative Coin Act of 1993 - Directs the Secretary of the Treasury to issue five-dollar gold coins, one-dollar silver coins, and half dollar clad coins emblematic of the U.S. Military Academy. Mandates that surcharges collected from coin sales be paid to the Association of Graduates, U.S. Military Academy, to assist its efforts to provide direct support to the Corps of Cadets, U.S. Military Academy.
